assessments.status_rationale: Today’s news does not include (or provide excerpts from) the published FOMC minutes for the March 2026 meeting, so word-count verification for “tariff” cannot yet be made.
No BLS PPI release data for reference months Jan–Jun 2026 (including the seasonally adjusted Final Demand Goods index m/m change) is provided in today’s bullets.
Today’s items do not report a U.S. 10-year Treasury yield close (FRED DGS10) below 3.50% or any specific yield close that would settle the claim.
No NAR Existing Home Sales (SAAR) monthly release value is cited in the news bullets, so the 4.50 million threshold cannot be assessed.
Today’s news does not include a BLS Employment Situation report or an unemployment rate (U-3) print that would confirm or refute reaching 4.3%.
No Federal Register notice from Commerce/BIS is referenced that proposes or implements an explicit licensing surcharge/fee mechanism for advanced AI chip exports to China.
The OpenAI-related headline concerns investor communications about Musk ahead of trial, not a disclosed compute procurement agreement with a non-Nvidia accelerator provider valued at $5B+.
No item reports a public confirmation by California’s DOJ/AG of issuing a subpoena/CID (or similar compulsory process) to xAI related to Grok image generation.

While Venezuela is in the news (including U.S. seizure of an oil tanker linked to Venezuela), there is no mention of OFAC issuing a new/amended Venezuela-related General License expanding authorized crude production/export transactions.

Today’s bullets discuss Iran-related connectivity/protests and regional geopolitics, but provide no evidence that the IAEA Board of Governors adopted a censure or non-compliance resolution regarding safeguards/enrichment cooperation.
